briefTitle: The Recovery of Reaching Movement in Breast Cancer Survivors: Two Different Rehabilitative Protocols in Comparison
officialTitle: The Recovery of Reaching Movement in Breast Cancer Survivors: Two Different Rehabilitative Protocols in Comparison
conditions: Breast Cancer, Breast Cancer Lymphedema, Pain, Pain, Postoperative, Pain, Chronic, Mastectomy; Lymphedema, Breast Surgery
primaryOutcomeMeasure: Change [over time] of the normalized jerk (NJ) within biomechanical reaching movement
eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* total mastectomy carried out 12 months prior to recruitment for rehabilitation with breast prostheses or tissue expanders performed
* age from 18 to 60 years
* body mass index (BMI) \< 30
* no cognitive dysfunctions ( Mini Mental State Examination MMSE \> 24)

Exclusion Criteria:

* presence of lymphangitis or mastitis
* presence of metastasis
* surgical complications
* neurological deficits
* shoulder joint problems before surgery
* severe-moderate lymphedema and web axillary syndrome
* visual problem not corrected by lenses
